pr_title: Add a state-lock call-tracker for detecting interrupt-cycles

timeline.message: Add a state-lock call-tracker for detecting interrupt-cycles

timeline.bodyText: Can we do this for recursive delete?
timeline.author: gpang
gpang

timeline.bodyText: Why does this throw an Exception, and not just return false?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Does this create a new CallTracker each time? Is there a way to have a single instance of the call tracker?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: What is preventing us from just adding the tracker to every single context? I thought it is up to the individual rpc to use it or not?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
The reasoning was to track tracked-APIs by explicitly working on them.
Currently, if an API decides to use the call-tracker, it must have been explicitly attached otherwise an exception is raised.
I already have a todo in this method to make it general.
replies.author: ggezer

replies.bodyText: Since deleteInternal() is used by many, I believe we can't go with fail-if-not-tracked approach anymore. So I might make this method called by all APIs as well.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: This is allowed to be @Nullable, right? We should handle that case.
timeline.author: gpang
